item.title: Report E-2024030300
item.description:
Report E-2024030300

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Dayton Freight’s personnel observed that an estimated that two (2) gallons of material was released due to a small puncture to the bottom of one (1) 50-gallon metal drum. Dayton Freight’s personnel deployed granular absorbents and recovered the spent material and containerized into one (1) overpack 120-gallon poly drum along with the damaged 50-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024030548
item.description:
Report X-2024030548

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-19T15:11:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-05
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 4th a pallet of thirty five gallon drums was damaged by a forklift. One of the drums was punctured allowing all of the liquid to leak out. The drum contained UN3082 Environmentally Hazardous Substance, liquid, n.o.s.(), 9, PGIII. The spill was cleaned up and the drum was placed into a steel salvage drum. An amended shippers dec has been requested.

item.title: Report E-2024030241
item.description:
Report E-2024030241

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: EDINBURGH
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 6, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of corrosive liquid was damaged by a faulty skid and released approximately one (1) quart of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Indiana Spill Response (ISR) to remediate the impacted site. ISR personnel placed the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 95-gallon overpack that was labeled as salvaged material for further handling by R+L. Crews swept in soda ash, then collected the neutralized product with hand tools. ISR personnel wiped down the dock floor with absorbent pads and cleaners. One (1) 55-gallon drum of neutralized product, PPE, and any cleanup debris was staged onsite for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024030293
item.description:
Report E-2024030293

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-17
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed that approximately fifteen (15) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a puncture from a forklift. The released material was recovered and containerized into one (1) 10-gallon poly pail. The damaged 55-gallon metal drum was patched with putty and staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
